title: Full Stack Engineer, Stripe Tax
content:

About the team
Stripe Tax is one of Stripeâ€™s most requested products and has grown rapidly since it launched in 2021.  The product solves an urgent need for almost everyone that sells something online. We provide solutions for calculating and reporting sales tax, VAT, and GST for over 40 countries. The product integrates seamlessly with other Stripe products but can also be used by merchants not using Stripe for payments. Weâ€™re rapidly expanding our feature set while weâ€™re scaling our engineering infrastructure to handle the increased traffic that weâ€™re seeing as a result of our growth.
What youâ€™ll do
Weâ€™re looking for people with a strong background or interest in building successful products and systems; youâ€™re comfortable in dealing with lots of moving pieces; you have exquisite attention to detail; and youâ€™re comfortable learning new technologies and systems.
Responsibilities
Build end-to-end experiences that make it as easy as possible to participate in the internet economy in a tax compliant manner.
Work on several parts of our systems, ranging from frontend, to backend, to infrastructure and operations, while optionally specializing in certain areas.
Be an active contributor in editing the company, ranging from how to improve our team processes, mentoring other engineers, and partaking in planning and strategy discussions with the ultimate goal of better serving our customers
Who you are
Weâ€™re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements
5+ years of professional experience in engineering or related fields.
Familiarity with some no-SQL databases (MongoDB preferred)
Enjoy being a generalist working on both the frontend, backend, and anything it takes to solve problems and delight users both internally and externally
Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts
Take pride in working on projects to successful completion involving a wide variety of technologies and systems
Ability to stitch together many different services and processes together even if you have not worked with them before
Ability to put yourself in the shoes of your users and be a steward of crafting great experiences
Enjoy working with a diverse group of people with different expertise
Ability to uphold best practices in engineering, security, and design
Preferred qualifications
Proficiency in Ruby and TypeScript.
Professional experience working with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.)

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
